title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 396.3 - Defenses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 396.3 - Defenses

State Regulations

The following defenses may be raised against the
interception of all or a part of the lottery prize: (a) the person who received the notice of the
lottery prize interception is not the person identified as owing and does not
owe public assistance; (b) all
public assistance received within the previous 10 years has been repaid in
full; (c) the amount of public
assistance received within the last 10 years and not repaid is less than the
amount set forth in the notice; (d) the amount of the prize was less than $600; and
(e) the amount intercepted was more than 50
percent of the prize. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
396.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
